name: SearchSecuritySignals
description:
Retrieve security signals based on a search query.

Use this tool to find security signals that match specific search criteria. Ideal for monitoring security alerts and potential threats.

parameters.name: minimum_timestamp
parameters.description: The minimum timestamp for requested security signals. Use ISO 8601 format, e.g., '2023-10-05T14:48:00Z'.

value_schema.description: The minimum timestamp for requested security signals.

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: A string used to search and filter the security signals based on specific criteria.

value_schema.description: Search query for listing security signals.

parameters.name: maximum_timestamp_for_signals
parameters.description: The latest date and time for security signals to be included in the search results, formatted as a string.

value_schema.description: The maximum timestamp for requested security signals.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor to continue listing results from the previous query. Use it for paginating results.

value_schema.description: A list of results using the cursor provided in the previous query.

parameters.name: maximum_signals_per_response
parameters.description: The maximum number of security signals to return in the response.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of security signals in the response.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify how to sort the security signals. Use 'timestamp' for ascending and '-timestamp' for descending order.

value_schema.description: The sort parameters used for querying security signals.
